_prev_prog_3.Description:
Americold Logistics, LLC Prevention Program:



The process at this facility is a closed loop industrial ammonia refrigeration system.  Mechanical compression and heat exchange cycles occur within the interconnected piping and equipment.  The elements of process safety management are implemented to assure the ammonia refrigeration system is operated safely.  A PHA revalidation was conducted on 5/23/2014 in order to identify hazards and address them adequately.  

Primary safeguards include ammonia detection and machinery room emergency ventilation.   The PSM/RMP prevention program is managed by facility staff to assure system equipment safeguards and industry standards are met to prevent accidental ammonia releases.  Mechanical Integrity of the process equipment is maintained through inspections, routine testing and appropriate levels of operator training.  Refrigeration system operators and contractors receive training for safe work practices to prevent all releases or stop them small in instance when incidental releases might occur.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary of Americold Logistics - Lancaster

The EPA Risk Management Submission Report



EPAA's Risk Management Prevention Program elements and Process Safety Management is implemented to protect the employees, the community and the environment and the integrity of the process.  Americold Logistics  is a company that has grown with a core guiding principle that we do what is right.   This principle implies a commitment to provide a safe work environment above and beyond general regulatory requirements.   Reducing the risks and affects of ammonia releases is a primary consideration of the safety programs and planning that goes on during routine operations.  The company employee activities, including safety are subject to key performance indicators.  The organization measures results to constantly improve risk exposure.  The balance of productivity, minimized risk, safety compliance, environmental stewardship and profitability are all part of the measure of success. 

Process safety program elements are built to overlap with employee health and safety training programs.  An employee emergency action and fire prevention plan is in place to provide safe egress and procedures for employees to follow during emergency situations, whether an evacuation or shelter in place.  Refrigeration employees and facility managers undergo at a minimum awareness level first responder training.  An emergency response plan and emergency response personnel are not in place at the facility.  Emergency response is provided by Mountville Fire Company and Lancaster County Hazmat in the event of an emergency situation requiring outside assistance.



Efforts to minimize the risk of an accidental ammonia release are achieved by adhering to and exceeding compliance requirements with attention focused on employee training and the integrity of the ammonia process equipment.  PSM is adopted as the culture to manage the ammonia refrigeration system safely to avoid hazardous consequences ass

ociated with anhydrous ammonia releases.  Refrigeration employees and contractors are required to achieve proficiency of all safe work practices to work on or near the process.  



This facility is a public refrigerated warehouse that provides refrigerated storage and distribution services to producers and manufacturers of food products.  The facility operates the anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system and provides employee ammonia awareness training experience for everyone working around the warehouse environment.



Five Year accident History- In the past five years their has not been  reportable ammonia release.  



This facility is subject to EPCRA Tier II reporting requirements and has submitted tier II reports annually in a timely manner.  This reporting provides local public safety officials with facility chemical use and storage, and facility contact information for emergency response.  



Hazmat training is provided for refrigeration personnel and employees with key rolls during emergency situations. This training is enhancing the confidence as Hazmat technicians and Incident command level support can work together with in the public safety sector.. Training to this level is in place to support local authorities with ammonia response specialists in an effort to coordinate response plans for the facility.
